abstract: The European Commission accused the company of setting artificially high fees for credit card transactions in the Continent.
snippet: The European Commission accused the company of setting artificially high fees for credit card transactions in the Continent.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — European antitrust officials filed formal charges against MasterCard on Thursday, accusing the company of setting artificially high fees for credit card transactions in the European Union, which ultimately may have hurt consumers.

headline.main: MasterCard Faces Antitrust Charges in E.U.
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Europe Charges MasterCard Over High Transaction Fees
